channel.title: Stand alone LCD screen, and what to do with it?
channel.description:
I was bored so I decided to take my broken camera apart(It was cheap and the shutter snapped.).
I took out some components like the lens, some crystal looking thing, LCD screen, mic, a small motor, a light, the button pad, and the main chip(Or whatever it's called.).
The only thing that I didn't have to rip out was the LCD screen, it was connected to the chip and it slid out just like a card, so I was thinking since it is in perfect condition why let it go to waste. It's not damaged at all.
[img]http://i536.photobucket.com/albums/ff321/zipl0ck/09201751.jpg[/img] [img]http://i536.photobucket.com/albums/ff321/zipl0ck/09201751a.jpg[/img] [img]http://i536.photobucket.com/albums/ff321/zipl0ck/09201752.jpg[/img]
Is there anything I can do with this? Such as hooking it up to another component to make like.. A mini-TV or something? :D
Also I have the microphone from it which is just a plastic circle with metal in the middle, and it has two wires coming out from it.

item.title: Stand alone LCD screen, and what to do with it?
item.dc:creator: @Reisyukaku Reisyukaku
item.description:
@Reisyukaku wrote:

Hey, thats a psp screen… amirite?

i have a bunch of 'em and cant figure out how to configure them to work with out the psp.

Read full topic

sell it to some gypsys.

item.source: Stand alone LCD screen, and what to do with it?

item.title: Stand alone LCD screen, and what to do with it?
item.dc:creator: @fozzy fozzy
item.description:
@fozzy wrote:

Really there’s not much you could do with it. That golden cable that comes out (Ribbon) is the IO device, I mean yeah if you could find a connector to plug it into sure, or maybe you could splice some of the ribbon apart to downsize it. Idk, if all else fails theres Google.

Read full topic
item.source: Stand alone LCD screen, and what to do with it?

item.title: Stand alone LCD screen, and what to do with it?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:3, topic:303459”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=399783.msg2964902#msg2964902 date=1253489455]
Your camera is a tad just fuzzy
[/quote]
Yep! 2 Megapixles.[/quote]
If you manualy focused you would have no problems. MP is irrelevant to the quality of a picture.

That connector looks familiar, if it is the same length, you could probably hook it up to a GBA. Your ideas on making a TV are far away since I doubt many tuners output video via a connection like that.
You could make a fan with the motor, You could even power it by USB using the cable that came with the camera.

ps, http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,146.0.html

Read full topic
